image.altText: A lady sitting and smiling off camera.

props.synopsis: State politicians are facing a crucial debate that will finally decide whether a stadium is built at Hobart's Macquarie Point and whether Tasmania gets an AFL side.

title.children: Tasmanian politicians under 'intense pressure' as answer on stadium looms

image.altText: Five people crowd around one person wearing a grey shirt over their head, the faces are blurred.

props.synopsis: An incident at a Tasmanian youth detention centre where a detainee had an improvised spit hood put over his head while being transported by a contracted security company, has been criticised for being "entirely incompatible" with human rights.

title.children: Young detainee forced to wear makeshift spit hood, report finds

image.altText: 'Yes stadium' and 'No stadium' stickers composite image.

props.synopsis: By the end of this week, Tasmania will know whether or not Hobart will have a new AFL stadium. Many Tasmanians are still making up their own minds about whether they support it or not.

title.children: The 'yes stadium' and 'no stadium' split still divides Tasmania

image.altText: Belinda and Kevin stand together and smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: A  Victorian tourist has been "blown away" after discovering a connection with a volunteer at the Hobart Penitentiary, with the volunteer noting people seem more open to discussing their convict histories.

title.children: Total strangers find Tasmanian convict connection

image.altText: An aerial view of two people standing next to hiking tents near a rocky outcrop overlooking a lake down below.

props.synopsis: There are concerns that social media is leading to poor bushwalking decisions with trends such as "rawdogging" a hike glorifying a lack of preparedness.

title.children: 'Illusion of simplicity': Social media glosses over dangers of bushwalking

image.altText: Matt Keogh speaks to the National Press Club.

props.synopsis: The veterans' affairs minister says Defence personnel who commit sexual violence will have their convictions recorded on their national criminal history check. Follow live.

title.children: Defence sexual violence convictions to be recorded on national database

image.altText: Unidentifiable domestic violence victim on the phone.

props.synopsis: Five women allege sexual misconduct against a Ballarat Bowen therapy business run by a father-son duo.

title.children: Five women allege sexual misconduct by father-son therapists

image.altText: Ambulance

props.synopsis: Construction workers and police officers have been praised for their quick thinking after two men became trapped when a retaining wall collapsed.

title.children: Man dies, another seriously injured after wall collapses in Brisbane

image.altText: A map shows the five regions Russia has long tried to occupy

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is expected to send his special envoy Steven Witkoff to Moscow this week to talk about a revised proposal for peace in Ukraine. There are five regions central to negotiations and Vladimir Putin wants them all.

title.children: Maps reveal Putin's red lines in Ukraine peace negotiations

image.altText: a massive smoke plume from a bushfire near Ravensthorpe.

props.synopsis: A man is killed while trying to establish a firebreak to help tackle a blaze near Ravensthorpe along WA's south coast, with the premier describing his death as "devastating".

title.children: 'Tight-knit' community reeling after farmer dies fighting fast-moving fire

image.altText: An artist's impression of a large multi-storey building with a Woolworths supermarket at ground level.

props.synopsis: The retail giant is using development fast-track schemes to push ahead with new supermarket and apartment projects opposed by local councils.

title.children: Woolworths accused of creating 'poor door' at affordable housing development

image.altText: A man with long grey hair holds a spear in a video editing suite.

props.synopsis: Acclaimed filmmaker George Gittoes has revealed a former NT police officer told him he witnessed his colleagues taking a Yolŋu clan leader out to shoot him and dump his body in Darwin Harbour in 1934.

title.children: Filmmaker reveals eyewitness saw police allegedly murder Aboriginal clan leader

image.altText: A chart tracks stock market lower

props.synopsis: The ASX edged higher, while the federal government released its National AI Plan. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX edges higher, government releases its National AI Plan - as it happened

image.altText: a mosquito

props.synopsis: The first detection of Japanese encephalitis virus for the summer has been made in a rural Victorian city.

title.children: Japanese encephalitis virus detected in Victoria

image.altText: A blue police tent is set up at the site of a fatal crash in Sydney's central business district

props.synopsis: The rider, a man aged in his 30s, was treated by paramedics but could not be saved.

title.children: NSW to cut power of e-bikes as rider killed in Sydney garbage truck crash

image.altText: A generic photo of a box of Ozempic pens.

props.synopsis: Ozempic-style medications have been recommended as long-term treatments for obesity under new guidelines released by the World Health Organization.

title.children: WHO declares obesity a disease, says Ozempic can be used to treat it

image.altText: An animated image of a night sky, with two ghostly cockatoos sitting on the branch of a big tree, in the starry sky

props.synopsis: All 88 internationally recognised constellations have European origins. But First Nations astronomy tells older, beautiful stories that contain invaluable lessons and knowledge.

title.children: Greek astronomy is ancient; this Wiradjuri knowledge is far older

image.altText: Pete Hegseth looking at the camera with a stern expression and furrowed brow.

props.synopsis: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth authorised an admiral to conduct multiple strikes that killed 11 people on a vessel from Venezuela allegedly carrying illegal narcotics in September.

title.children: Hegseth authorised drug boat strike criticised by Trump

image.altText: A close-up of a sea snake on the ocean floor staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: Locals and marine life experts raise concern over an increased amount of reptiles washing up on WA's north-west shores, with reports of stranded sea snakes and turtles being spotted on beaches.

title.children: Highly venomous sea snakes found dead on WA shores

image.altText: A woman wearing a yellow kimono speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Historically, Japan has had numerous women monarchs. But current laws prevent the emperor's daughter from succeeding him — and politicians, including the prime minister, support the status quo.

title.children: Princess's popularity spurs calls to ditch male-only succession in Japan

image.altText: Dr Ash Gordon wears a white collared shirt and blue blazer and smiles in front of a cream brick wall.

props.synopsis: Ashley Gordon grew up in the Victorian coal mining town of Morwell and went on to become a doctor before he was murdered.

title.children: Man sentenced to 17 years in jail for murder of Melbourne doctor

image.altText: A family at a music festival, carrying gold pans.

props.synopsis: A festival that has been running for 30 years has been cancelled just days before it was due to begin.

title.children: Victorian music festival cancelled at last minute due to fire safety, permit problems

image.altText: Prince Andrew in jacket and tie looking worried

props.synopsis: Andrew has been under renewed pressure in recent weeks over his relationship with late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and has been summoned to appear before a US congressional panel investigating Epstein.

title.children: Former prince Andrew stripped of remaining royal titles

image.altText: A man with short hair is pictured inside an apartment building.

props.synopsis: Disability advocates say cuts to Deaf participants' NDIS funding is a "systemic" problem that reflects a belief that Deafness can be "fixed".

title.children: 'I never wanted speech therapy': Deaf man incensed by NDIS recommendation

image.altText: A car sits in the remains of a house that has been destroyed by flooding

props.synopsis: Indonesia, Thailand and Sri Lanka are reeling from flooding that has killed hundreds in each country and destroyed communities.

title.children: More than 1,160 dead after extreme flooding across Asia

image.altText: A green tractor sits on brown soil.

props.synopsis: After years of depending on dealership networks for essential repairs, farmers will have the right to fix their own equipment.

title.children: Right to repair reforms to be expanded to farm machinery

image.altText: People looking at burning building in Hong Kong's Wang Fuk Court.

props.synopsis: The blaze that consumed Wang Fuk Court burned for two days, but its political shock waves may echo for weeks, even months.

title.children: Hong Kong's grief meets Beijing's red lines

image.altText: Nick Morgan has a thick beard and is wearing a high-vis yellow shirt with a black cap.

props.synopsis: A home owner who lost his house and his cat to a bushfire in Geraldton, in WA's Mid West, says "karma" is looking for anyone who may have deliberately lit the blazes.

title.children: Man who lost home, cat in Geraldton bushfire trying to avoid 'anger path'

image.altText: Two police officers stand outside a police van

props.synopsis: A 63-year-old man charged with murder (domestic violence) is due to face Cairns Magistrates Court on Wednesday.

title.children: Man charged with murder after stabbing in Far North Queensland

image.altText: A middle-aged, white-haired man in a blazer stands outside a brick home.

props.synopsis: A Lions Club member who ordered an investigation into how Need for Feed subsidised volunteer drivers is speaking out after recommendations to improve transparency were not implemented.

title.children: Volunteers quit en masse at major charity over pay dispute

image.altText: A young woman with two high school students.

props.synopsis: As staff shortages "near crisis point", these Queensland schools are going to extraordinary lengths to put teachers in classrooms — and keep them there.

title.children: Schools desperate for solutions as teacher shortage nears 'crisis point'

image.altText: A young man in a jacket sits in a court room

props.synopsis: Mr Mangione, who was arrested in 2024, has been charged with fatally shooting UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in Midtown Manhattan.

title.children: Luigi Mangione's arrest videos and worker's 911 call played at hearings

image.altText: report cover

props.synopsis: The document, prepared for the Queensland government, has been exclusively obtained by the ABC.

title.children: Secret audit reveals millions pocketed in hidden travel management deals

image.altText: A close up of Matildas coach Joe Montemurro's face with the Australian flag on a big screen in the background.

props.synopsis: Joe Montemurro echoes the words of former Matildas boss Alen Stajcic in offering a frank review of the culture surrounding the world game in Australia.

title.children: Matildas coach calls out Australian football's 'inferiority complex'

image.altText: An image of three young people, two female and one male, looking at mobile phones. A bright pink background is behind them.

props.synopsis: BTN surveyed more than 17,000 Australians under 16 about the federal government's upcoming social media ban. This is what they said.

title.children: What 17,000-plus young people think about the social media ban
